fields.name: clsID
fields.description: Class ID of the Acknowledged Message

fields.name: msgID
fields.description: Message ID of the Acknowledged Message

fields.name: clsID
fields.description: Class ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

fields.name: msgID
fields.description: Message ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

bits.name: clearAll
bits.description: Clear all saved configuration from the selected non-volatile memory if any bit is set

bits.name: saveAll
bits.description: Save all current configuration to the selected non-volatile memory if any bit is set

bits.name: loadAll
bits.description: Discard current configuration and rebuilt it from lower non-volatile memory layers if any bit is set

fields.name: deviceMask
fields.description: Mask which selects the memory devices for saving and/or clearing operation

bits.name: devBBR
bits.description: Battery-backed RAM

bits.name: devFlash
bits.description: Flash

bits.name: devEEPROM
bits.description: EEPROM (only supported for protocol versions less than 14.00)

bits.name: devSpiFlash
bits.description: SPI Flash (only supported for protocol versions less than 14.00)

messages.name: UBX-CFG-RST
messages.description: Reset receiver / Clear backup data structures

fields.name: navBbrMask
fields.description: BBR sections to clear. The following special sets apply: 0x0000 Hot start, 0x0001 Warm start, 0xFFFF Cold start

bits.name: eph
bits.description: Ephemeris

bits.name: alm
bits.description: Almanac

bits.name: health
bits.description: Health

bits.name: klob
bits.description: Klobuchar parameters

bits.name: pos
bits.description: Position

bits.name: clkd
bits.description: Clock drift

bits.name: osc
bits.description: Oscillator parameter

bits.name: utc
bits.description: UTC correction + GPS leap seconds parameters

bits.name: rtc
bits.description: RTC

bits.name: sfdr
bits.description: SFDR Parameters (only available on the ADR/UDR/HPS product variant) and weak signal compensation estimates

bits.name: vmon
bits.description: SFDR Vehicle Monitoring Parameter (only available on the ADR/UDR/HPS product variant)

bits.name: tct
bits.description: TCT Parameters (only available on the ADR/UDR/HPS product variant)

bits.name: aop
bits.description: Autonomous orbit parameters

fields.name: resetMode
fields.description: Reset Type: 0x00 = Hardware reset (watchdog) immediately, 0x01 = Controlled software reset, 0x02 = Controlled software reset (GNSS only), 0x04 = Hardware reset (watchdog) after shutdown, 0x08 = Controlled GNSS stop, 0x09 = Controlled GNSS start

fields.name: layers
fields.description: The layers where the configuration should be deleted from

bits.name: bbr
bits.description: Delete configuration from the BBR layer

bits.name: flash
bits.description: Delete configuration from the Flash layer

repeated_groups.name: keys
repeated_groups.description: Configuration key IDs of the configuration items to be deleted

fields.name: keys
fields.description: Configuration key IDs of the configuration items to be deleted

fields.name: layer
fields.description: The layer from which the configuration items should be retrieved: 0 - RAM layer, 1 - BBR layer, 2 - Flash layer, 7 - Default layer

fields.name: position
fields.description: Skip this many key values before constructing output message

repeated_groups.name: keys
repeated_groups.description: Configuration key IDs of the configuration items to be retrieved

fields.name: keys
fields.description: Configuration key IDs of the configuration items to be retrieved

fields.name: layers
fields.description: The layers where the configuration should be applied

bits.name: ram
bits.description: Update configuration in the RAM layer

bits.name: bbr
bits.description: Update configuration in the BBR layer

bits.name: flash
bits.description: Update configuration in the Flash layer

messages.name: UBX-LOG-BATCH
messages.description: Batched data combining position, velocity and time solution, including accuracy figures

bits.name: extraPvt
bits.description: Extra PVT information is valid

bits.name: extraOdo
bits.description: Odometer data is valid

fields.name: msgCnt
fields.description: Message counter; increments for each sent UBX-LOG-BATCH message

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch

bits.name: validDate
bits.description: 1 = valid UTC Date

bits.name: validTime
bits.description: 1 = valid UTC Time of Day

bits.name: gnssFixOK
bits.description: 1 = valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

bits.name: diffSoln
bits.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

bits.name: psmState
bits.description: Power save mode state

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Number of satellites used in Nav Solution

bits.name: sendMonFirst
bits.description: Send UBX-MON-BATCH message before sending the UBX-LOG-BATCH message(s).

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of acknowledgment: 0 = The message was not used by the receiver (see infoCode field for an indication of why), 1 = The message was accepted for use by the receiver (the infoCode field will be 0)

fields.name: infoCode
fields.description: Provides greater information on what the receiver chose to do with the message contents: 0 = The receiver accepted the data, 1 = The receiver does not know the time so it cannot use the data, 2 = The message version is not supported by the receiver, 3 = The message size does not match the message version, 4 = The message data could not be stored to the database, 5 = The receiver is not ready to use the message data, 6 = The message type is unknown

fields.name: msgId
fields.description: UBX message ID of the acknowledged message

fields.name: msgPayloadStart
fields.description: The first 4 bytes of the acknowledged message's payload

messages.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-EPH
messages.description: BeiDou ephemeris assistance for satellites svId 1..37

fields.name: Deltan
fields.description: Mean motion difference from computed value

fields.name: Omega0
fields.description: Longitude of ascending node of orbital plane computed according to reference time

fields.name: Cuc
fields.description: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

fields.name: Cus
fields.description: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

fields.name: Crc
fields.description: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

fields.name: Crs
fields.description: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

fields.name: Cic
fields.description: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

fields.name: Cis
fields.description: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

fields.name: deltaI
fields.description: Almanac correction of orbit reference inclination at reference time

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Almanac square root of semi-major axis

fields.name: M0
fields.description: Almanac mean anomaly at reference time

fields.name: Omega0
fields.description: Almanac longitude of ascending node of orbit plane at computed according to reference time

fields.name: healthCode
fields.description: Each two-byte value represents a BeiDou SV (1-30). The 9 LSBs of each byte contain the 9 bit health code from subframe 5 pages 7,8 of the D1 message, and from subframe 5 pages 35,36 of the D2 message.

fields.name: a0UTC
fields.description: BDT clock bias relative to UTC

fields.name: a1UTC
fields.description: BDT clock rate relative to UTC

fields.name: dtLS
fields.description: Delta time due to leap seconds before the new leap second effective

fields.name: wnRec
fields.description: BeiDou week number of reception of this UTC parameter set (8-bit truncated)

fields.name: wnLSF
fields.description: Week number of the new leap second

fields.name: dN
fields.description: Day number of the new leap second

fields.name: dtLSF
fields.description: Delta time due to leap seconds after the new leap second effective

messages.name: UBX-MGA-FLASH
messages.description: Transfer MGA-ANO data block to flash

fields.name: sequence
fields.description: Message sequence number, starting at 0 and incrementing by 1 for each MGA-FLASH-DATA message sent.

fields.name: iodNav
fields.description: Ephemeris and clock correction Issue of Data

fields.name: deltaN
fields.description: Mean motion difference from computed value

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Square root of the semi-major axis

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Longitude of ascending node of orbital plane at weekly epoch

fields.name: omegaDot
fields.description: Rate of change of right ascension

fields.name: iDot
fields.description: Rate of change of inclination angle

fields.name: cuc
fields.description: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

fields.name: cus
fields.description: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

fields.name: crc
fields.description: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

fields.name: crs
fields.description: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

fields.name: cic
fields.description: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

fields.name: cis
fields.description: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

fields.name: af2
fields.description: SV clock drift rate correction coefficient

fields.name: sisaIndexE1E5b
fields.description: Signal-In-Space Accuracy index for dual frequency E1-E5b

fields.name: toc
fields.description: Clock correction data reference Time of Week

fields.name: deltaSqrtA
fields.description: Difference with respect to the square root of the nominal semi-major axis (29 600 km)

fields.name: deltaI
fields.description: Inclination at reference time relative to i0 = 56 degree

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Longitude of ascending node of orbital plane at weekly epoch

fields.name: omegaDot
fields.description: Rate of change of right ascension

fields.name: m0
fields.description: Satellite mean anomaly at reference time

fields.name: a0G
fields.description: Constant term of the polynomial describing the offset

fields.name: a1G
fields.description: Rate of change of the offset

fields.name: dtLS
fields.description: Delta time due to current leap seconds

fields.name: tot
fields.description: UTC parameters reference time of week (Galileo time)

fields.name: wnt
fields.description: UTC parameters reference week number (the 8-bit WNt field)

fields.name: wnLSF
fields.description: Week number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective (the 8-bit WNLSF field)

fields.name: dN
fields.description: Day number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective

fields.name: dtLSF
fields.description: Delta time due to future leap seconds

fields.name: M
fields.description: Type of GLONASS satellite (1 indicates GLONASS-M)

fields.name: H
fields.description: Carrier frequency number of navigation RF signal, Range=(-7 .. 6), -128 for unknown

fields.name: x
fields.description: X component of the SV position in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y component of the SV position in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: z
fields.description: Z component of the SV position in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: dx
fields.description: X component of the SV velocity in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: dy
fields.description: Y component of the SV velocity in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: dz
fields.description: Z component of the SV velocity in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddx
fields.description: X component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddy
fields.description: Y component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddz
fields.description: Z component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: tb
fields.description: Index of a time interval within current day according to UTC(SU)

fields.name: deltaTau
fields.description: Time difference between L2 and L1 band

fields.name: N
fields.description: Reference calendar day number of almanac within the four-year period (from string 5)

fields.name: M
fields.description: Type of GLONASS satellite (1 indicates GLONASS-M)

fields.name: C
fields.description: Unhealthy flag at instant of almanac upload (1 indicates operability of satellite)

fields.name: tau
fields.description: Coarse time correction to GLONASS time

fields.name: lambda
fields.description: Longitude of the first (within the N-day) ascending node of satellite orbit in PC-90.02 coordinate system

fields.name: deltaI
fields.description: Correction to the mean value of inclination

fields.name: tLambda
fields.description: Time of the first ascending node passage

fields.name: deltaT
fields.description: Correction to the mean value of Draconian period

fields.name: deltaDT
fields.description: Rate of change of Draconian period

fields.name: H
fields.description: Carrier frequency number of navigation RF signal, Range=(-7 .. 6)

fields.name: N
fields.description: Reference calendar day number within the four-year period of almanac (from string 5)

fields.name: tauC
fields.description: Time scale correction to UTC(SU) time

fields.name: tauGps
fields.description: Correction to GPS time relative to GLONASS time

fields.name: B2
fields.description: Rate of change of delta UT1

fields.name: deltaN
fields.description: Mean motion difference from computed value

fields.name: cuc
fields.description: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to argument of latitude

fields.name: cus
fields.description: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to argument of latitude

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Square root of the semi-major axis

fields.name: cic
fields.description: Amplitude of cos harmonic correction term to angle of inclination

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Longitude of ascending node of orbit plane at weekly epoch

fields.name: cis
fields.description: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to angle of inclination

fields.name: crc
fields.description: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to orbit radius

fields.name: almWNa
fields.description: Reference week number of almanac (the 8-bit WNa field)

fields.name: deltaI
fields.description: Delta inclination angle at reference time

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Square root of the semi-major axis

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Longitude of ascending node of orbit plane

fields.name: healthCode
fields.description: Each byte represents a GPS SV (1-32). The 6 LSBs of each byte contains the 6 bit health code from subframes 4/5 page 25.

fields.name: utcDtLS
fields.description: Delta time due to current leap seconds

fields.name: utcTot
fields.description: UTC parameters reference time of week (GPS time)

fields.name: utcWNt
fields.description: UTC parameters reference week number (the 8-bit WNt field)

fields.name: utcWNlsf
fields.description: Week number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective (the 8-bit WNLSF field)

fields.name: utcDn
fields.description: Day number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective

fields.name: utcDtLSF
fields.description: Delta time due to future leap seconds

fields.name: N
fields.description: Reference calendar day number within the four-year period of almanac (from string 5)

fields.name: tauC
fields.description: Time scale correction to UTC(SU) time

fields.name: tauGps
fields.description: Correction to GPS time relative to GLONASS time

fields.name: B2
fields.description: Rate of change of delta UT1

fields.name: ref
fields.description: Reference to be used to set time

bits.name: source
bits.description: 0 = none, i.e. on receipt of message (will be inaccurate!), 1 = relative to pulse sent to EXTINT0, 2 = relative to pulse sent to EXTINT1, 3-15 = reserved

bits.name: fall
bits.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising) - only if source is EXTINT

bits.name: last
bits.description: use last EXTINT pulse (default next pulse) - only if source is EXTINT

fields.name: leapSecs
fields.description: Number of leap seconds since 1980 (or 0x80 = -128 if unknown)

bits.name: trustedSource
bits.description: Time is provided from a trusted source. Potentially usable for replay attack detection. 0: Unknown, 1: Time source can be trusted for spoofing detection

fields.name: tAccNs
fields.description: Nanoseconds part of time accuracy, from 0 to 999,999,999

fields.name: ref
fields.description: Reference to be used to set time

bits.name: source
bits.description: 0 = none, i.e. on receipt of message (will be inaccurate!), 1 = relative to pulse sent to EXTINT0, 2 = relative to pulse sent to EXTINT1, 3-15 = reserved

bits.name: fall
bits.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising) - only if source is EXTINT

bits.name: last
bits.description: use last EXTINT pulse (default next pulse) - only if source is EXTINT

fields.name: gnssId
fields.description: Source of time information. Currently supported: 0 = GPS time, 2 = Galileo time, 3 = BeiDou time, 6 = GLONASS time, 7 = NavIC time

bits.name: trustedSource
bits.description: Time is provided from a trusted source. Potentially usable for replay attack detection - 0: Unknown, 1: Time source can be trusted for spoofing detection

fields.name: ns
fields.description: GNSS time of week, nanosecond part from 0 to 999,999,999

fields.name: tAccNs
fields.description: Nanoseconds part of time accuracy, from 0 to 999,999,999

bits.name: source
bits.description: 0 = frequency available on EXTINT0, 1 = frequency available on EXTINT1, 2-15 = reserved

bits.name: fall
bits.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising)

fields.name: d2kMax
fields.description: Maximum number of days for which the data is valid from d2kRef

fields.name: ypP0
fields.description: Y component of pole motion at reference time

fields.name: ypP1
fields.description: First derivative of Y component of pole motion

fields.name: ypP2
fields.description: Second derivative of Y component of pole motion

fields.name: svId
fields.description: QZSS Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering), Range 1-5

fields.name: deltaN
fields.description: Mean motion difference from computed value

fields.name: cuc
fields.description: Amp of cosine harmonic corr term to arg of lat

fields.name: cus
fields.description: Amp of sine harmonic corr term to arg of lat

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Square root of the semi-major axis A

fields.name: cic
fields.description: Amp of cos harmonic corr term to angle of inclination

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Long of asc node of orbit plane at weekly epoch

fields.name: cis
fields.description: Amp of sine harmonic corr term to angle of inclination

fields.name: crc
fields.description: Amp of cosine harmonic corr term to orbit radius

fields.name: svId
fields.description: QZSS Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering), Range 1-5

fields.name: almWNa
fields.description: Reference week number of almanac (the 8-bit WNa field)

fields.name: deltaI
fields.description: Delta inclination angle at reference time

fields.name: sqrtA
fields.description: Almanac square root of the semi-major axis A

fields.name: omega0
fields.description: Almanac long of asc node of orbit plane at weekly

fields.name: m0
fields.description: Almanac mean anomaly at reference time

fields.name: healthCode
fields.description: Each byte represents a QZSS SV (1-5). The 6 LSBs of each byte contains the 6 bit health code from subframes 4/5, data ID = 3, SV ID = 51

fields.name: fillLevel
fields.description: Current buffer fill level, i.e. number of epochs currently stored

fields.name: dropsAll
fields.description: Number of dropped epochs since startup Note: changing the batching configuration will reset this counter.

fields.name: dropsSinceMon
fields.description: Number of dropped epochs since last MON-BATCH message

fields.name: nextMsgCnt
fields.description: The next retrieved UBX-LOG-BATCH will have this msgCnt value.

bits.name: mem
bits.description: Memory Allocation error

bits.name: alloc
bits.description: Allocation error (TX buffer full)

fields.name: protIds
fields.description: The identifiers of the protocols reported in the msgs array. 0: UBX, 1: NMEA, 2: RTCM2, 5: RTCM3, 6: SPARTN, 0xFF: No protocol reported.

repeated_groups.name: ports
repeated_groups.description: Port information repeated for each port

fields.name: portId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the port. See section Communications ports in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: txPending
fields.description: Number of bytes pending in transmitter buffer

fields.name: txUsage
fields.description: Maximum usage transmitter buffer during the last sysmon period

fields.name: rxPending
fields.description: Number of bytes in receiver buffer

fields.name: rxUsage
fields.description: Maximum usage receiver buffer during the last sysmon period

fields.name: overrunErrs
fields.description: Number of 100 ms timeslots with overrun errors

fields.name: msgs
fields.description: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol. The reported protocols are identified through the protIds field.

fields.name: nPins
fields.description: The number of I/O pins included

bits.name: rtcCalib
bits.description: RTC is calibrated

bits.name: safeBoot
bits.description: Safeboot mode (0 = inactive, 1 = active)

bits.name: xtalAbsent
bits.description: RTC xtal has been determined to be absent

fields.name: hwVersion
fields.description: Zero-terminated hardware version string (same as that returned in the UBX-MON-VER message)

fields.name: pinId
fields.description: Identifier for the pin, including both external and internal pins

bits.name: periphPIO
bits.description: Pin is set to peripheral or PIO? 0=Peripheral 1=PIO

bits.name: pinBank
bits.description: Bank the pin belongs to, where 0=A 1=B 2=C 3=D 4=E 5=F 6=G 7=H

bits.name: direction
bits.description: Pin direction? 0=Input 1=Output

bits.name: value
bits.description: Pin value? 0=Low 1=High

bits.name: vpManager
bits.description: Used by virtual pin manager? 0=No 1=Yes

bits.name: pioIrq
bits.description: Interrupt enabled? 0=No 1=Yes

bits.name: pioPullHigh
bits.description: Using pull high resistor? 0=No 1=Yes

bits.name: pioPullow
bits.description: Using pull low resistor? 0=No 1=Yes

fields.name: patchInfo
fields.description: Status information about the reported patch

bits.name: activated
bits.description: 1: the patch is active, 0: otherwise

bits.name: location
bits.description: Indicates where the patch is stored. 0: eFuse, 1: ROM, 2: BBR, 3: file system

fields.name: patchAddress
fields.description: The address that is targeted by the patch

fields.name: patchData
fields.description: The data that is inserted at the patchAddress

fields.name: nBlocks
fields.description: The number of RF blocks included

repeated_groups.name: RF block information
repeated_groups.description: RF block information repeated nBlocks times

fields.name: blockId
fields.description: RF block ID (0 = L1 band, 1 = L2 or L5 band depending on product configuration)

bits.name: jammingState
bits.description: Output from jamming/interference monitor (0 = unknown or feature disabled or flag unavailable, 1 = ok - no significant jamming, 2 = warning - interference visible but fix OK, 3 = critical - interference visible and no fix). This flag is deprecated in protocol versions that support UBX-SEC-SIG (version 0x02) and always reported as 0; instead jamming info in UBX-SEC-SIG should be monitored.

fields.name: antStatus
fields.description: Status of the antenna supervisor state machine (0x00=INIT, 0x01=DONTKNOW, 0x02=OK, 0x03=SHORT, 0x04=OPEN)

fields.name: noisePerMS
fields.description: Noise level as measured by the GPS core

fields.name: agcCnt
fields.description: AGC Monitor, as percentage of maximum gain, range 0 to 8191 (100%)

fields.name: cwSuppression
fields.description: CW interference suppression level, scaled (0=no CW jamming, 255 = strong CW jamming)

fields.name: ofsI
fields.description: Imbalance of I-part of complex signal, scaled (-128 = max. negative imbalance, 127 = max. positive imbalance)

fields.name: magI
fields.description: Magnitude of I-part of complex signal, scaled (0 = no signal, 255 = max.magnitude)

fields.name: ofsQ
fields.description: Imbalance of Q-part of complex signal, scaled (-128 = max. negative imbalance, 127 = max. positive imbalance)

fields.name: magQ
fields.description: Magnitude of Q-part of complex signal, scaled (0 = no signal, 255 = max.magnitude)

bits.name: awake
bits.description: not in backup mode

messages.name: UBX-MON-SPAN
messages.description: Signal characteristics spectrum analyzer message displaying one spectrum for each RF path with frequency span, resolution, center frequency, and PGA gain information

repeated_groups.name: rfBlocks
repeated_groups.description: RF block data repeated numRFBlocks times

fields.name: spectrum
fields.description: Spectrum data (number of points = span/res) [Uuu.ff dB]

repeated_groups.name: extension
repeated_groups.description: Extended software information strings. A series of nul-terminated strings. Each extension field is 30 characters long and contains varying software information. Not all extension fields may appear.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

fields.name: status
fields.description: AssistNow Autonomous subsystem is idle (0) or running (not 0)

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section Navigation epochs in the integration manual for details. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: numSv
fields.description: Number of SVs in the database

bits.name: health
bits.description: SV health: 0 = unknown, 1 = healthy, 2 = not healthy

bits.name: visibility
bits.description: SV visibility: 0 = unknown, 1 = below horizon, 2 = above horizon, 3 = above elevation mask

bits.name: ephUsability
bits.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the stored ephemeris data from now on

bits.name: ephSource
bits.description: Ephemeris source: 0 = not available, 1 = GNSS transmission, 2 = external aiding, 3-7 = other

bits.name: almUsability
bits.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the stored almanac data from now on

bits.name: almSource
bits.description: Almanac source: 0 = not available, 1 = GNSS transmission, 2 = external aiding, 3-7 = other

bits.name: anoAopUsability
bits.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the orbit data from now on

bits.name: type
bits.description: Type of orbit data: 0 = No orbit data available, 1 = AssistNow Offline data, 2 = AssistNow Autonomous data, 3-7 = Other orbit data

fields.name: tmirCoeff
fields.description: Target misleading information risk (TMIR) [%MI/epoch], coefficient integer number of base 10 scientific notation (see e.g. plPos field)

fields.name: tmirExp
fields.description: Target misleading information risk (TMIR) [%MI/epoch], exponent integer number of base 10 scientific notation (see e.g. plPos field)

fields.name: plPos1
fields.description: First axis of position protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plPosFrame (see plPosFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plPos2
fields.description: Second axis of position protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plPosFrame (see plPosFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plPos3
fields.description: Third axis of position protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plPosFrame (see plPosFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plVel1
fields.description: First axis of velocity protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plVelFrame (see plVelFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plVel2
fields.description: Second axis of velocity protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plVelFrame (see plVelFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plVel3
fields.description: Third axis of velocity protection level value, given in coordinate frame of plVelFrame (see plVelFrame field for value order), w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: plPosHorizOrient
fields.description: Orientation of HorizSemiMajorAxis (see plPosFrame) of horizontal ellipse position protection level (clockwise degrees from true North), if plPosFrame==3; zero otherwise.

fields.name: plVelHorizOrient
fields.description: Orientation of HorizSemiMajorAxis (see plVelFrame) of horizontal ellipse velocity protection level (clockwise degrees from true North), if plVelFrame==3; zero otherwise.

fields.name: plTime
fields.description: Time protection level value, w.r.t. the given target misleading information risk (TMIR) of [tmirCoeff * 10^(tmirExp)]

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

bits.name: validDate
bits.description: 1 = valid UTC Date (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: validTime
bits.description: 1 = valid UTC time of day (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: fullyResolved
bits.description: 1 = UTC time of day has been fully resolved (no seconds uncertainty). Cannot be used to check if time is completely available.

bits.name: validMag
bits.description: 1 = valid magnetic declination

fields.name: fixType
fields.description: GNSSfix Type: 0 = no fix, 1 = dead reckoning only, 2 = 2D-fix, 3 = 3D-fix, 4 = GNSS + dead reckoning combined, 5 = time only fix

bits.name: gnssFixOK
bits.description: 1 = valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

bits.name: diffSoln
bits.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

bits.name: psmState
bits.description: Power save mode state (see Power management section in the integration manual for details. 0 = PSM is not active, 1 = Enabled (an intermediate state before Acquisition state, 2 = Acquisition, 3 = Tracking, 4 = Power Optimized Tracking, 5 = Inactive

bits.name: headVehValid
bits.description: 1 = heading of vehicle is valid, only set if the receiver is in sensor fusion mode

bits.name: carrSoln
bits.description: Carrier phase range solution status: 0 = no carrier phase range solution, 1 = carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities, 2 = carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

bits.name: confirmedAvai
bits.description: 1 = information about UTC Date and Time of Day validity confirmation is available (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: confirmedDate
bits.description: 1 = UTC Date validity could be confirmed (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: confirmedTime
bits.description: 1 = UTC Time of Day could be confirmed (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Number of satellites used in Nav Solution

fields.name: headAcc
fields.description: Heading accuracy estimate (both motion and vehicle)

bits.name: invalidLlh
bits.description: 1 = Invalid lon, lat, height and hMSL

bits.name: lastCorrectionAge
bits.description: Age of the most recently received differential correction: 0 = Not available, 1 = Age between 0 and 1 second, 2 = Age between 1 (inclusive) and 2 seconds, 3 = Age between 2 (inclusive) and 5 seconds, 4 = Age between 5 (inclusive) and 10 seconds, 5 = Age between 10 (inclusive) and 15 seconds, 6 = Age between 15 (inclusive) and 20 seconds, 7 = Age between 20 (inclusive) and 30 seconds, 8 = Age between 30 (inclusive) and 45 seconds, 9 = Age between 45 (inclusive) and 60 seconds, 10 = Age between 60 (inclusive) and 90 seconds, 11 = Age between 90 (inclusive) and 120 seconds, >=12 = Age greater or equal than 120 seconds

bits.name: authTime
bits.description: Flag that indicates if the output time has been validated against an external trusted time source: 0 = Time is not authenticated, 1 = Time is authenticated

fields.name: headVeh
fields.description: Heading of vehicle (2-D), this is only valid when headVehValid is set, otherwise the output is set to the heading of motion

fields.name: magDec
fields.description: Magnetic declination. Only supported in ADR 4.10 and later.

fields.name: magAcc
fields.description: Magnetic declination accuracy. Only supported in ADR 4.10 and later.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: gnssId
fields.description: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: svId
fields.description: Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: elev
fields.description: Elevation (range: +/-90), unknown if out of range

fields.name: azim
fields.description: Azimuth (range 0-360), unknown if elevation is out of range

bits.name: qualityInd
bits.description: Signal quality indicator: 0 = no signal, 1 = searching signal, 2 = signal acquired, 3 = signal detected but unusable, 4 = code locked and time synchronized, 5, 6, 7 = code and carrier locked and time synchronized

bits.name: svUsed
bits.description: 1 = Signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers is currently being used for navigation

bits.name: health
bits.description: Signal health flag: 0 = unknown, 1 = healthy, 2 = unhealthy

bits.name: diffCorr
bits.description: 1 = differential correction data is available for this SV

bits.name: smoothed
bits.description: 1 = carrier smoothed pseudorange used

bits.name: orbitSource
bits.description: Orbit source: 0 = no orbit information is available for this SV, 1 = ephemeris is used, 2 = almanac is used, 3 = AssistNow Offline orbit is used, 4 = AssistNow Autonomous orbit is used, 5, 6, 7 = other orbit information is used

bits.name: ephAvail
bits.description: 1 = ephemeris is available for this SV

bits.name: almAvail
bits.description: 1 = almanac is available for this SV

bits.name: anoAvail
bits.description: 1 = AssistNow Offline data is available for this SV

bits.name: aopAvail
bits.description: 1 = AssistNow Autonomous data is available for this SV

bits.name: sbasCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = SBAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: rtcmCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = RTCM corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: slasCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = QZSS SLAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: spartnCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = SPARTN corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: prCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Pseudorange corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: crCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Carrier range corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: doCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Range rate (Doppler) corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bits.name: clasCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = CLAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

fields.name: geo
fields.description: PRN Number of the GEO where correction and integrity data is used from

bits.name: Ranging
bits.description: GEO may be used as ranging source

bits.name: Corrections
bits.description: GEO is providing correction data

bits.name: Integrity
bits.description: GEO is providing integrity

bits.name: Testmode
bits.description: GEO is in test mode

bits.name: Bad
bits.description: Problem with signal or broadcast data indicated

bits.name: integrityUsed
bits.description: SBAS integrity used

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

repeated_groups.name: signals
repeated_groups.description: Signal information for each tracked signal

fields.name: gnssId
fields.description: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: svId
fields.description: Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: sigId
fields.description: New style signal identifier (see Signal Identifiers)

fields.name: freqId
fields.description: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

fields.name: qualityInd
fields.description: Signal quality indicator: 0 = no signal, 1 = searching signal, 2 = signal acquired, 3 = signal detected but unusable, 4 = code locked and time synchronized, 5, 6, 7 = code and carrier locked and time synchronized

fields.name: corrSource
fields.description: Correction source: 0 = no corrections, 1 = SBAS corrections, 2 = BeiDou corrections, 3 = RTCM2 corrections, 4 = RTCM3 OSR corrections, 5 = RTCM3 SSR corrections, 6 = QZSS SLAS corrections, 7 = SPARTN corrections, 8 = CLAS corrections

fields.name: ionoModel
fields.description: Ionospheric model used: 0 = no model, 1 = Klobuchar model transmitted by GPS, 2 = SBAS model, 3 = Klobuchar model transmitted by BeiDou, 8 = Iono delay derived from dual frequency observations

bits.name: health
bits.description: Signal health flag: 0 = unknown, 1 = healthy, 2 = unhealthy

bits.name: prSmoothed
bits.description: 1 = Pseudorange has been smoothed

bits.name: prUsed
bits.description: 1 = Pseudorange has been used for this signal

bits.name: crUsed
bits.description: 1 = Carrier range has been used for this signal

bits.name: doUsed
bits.description: 1 = Range rate (Doppler) has been used for this signal

bits.name: prCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Pseudorange corrections have been used for this signal

bits.name: crCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Carrier range corrections have been used for this signal

bits.name: doCorrUsed
bits.description: 1 = Range rate (Doppler) corrections have been used for this signal

bits.name: authStatus
bits.description: Authentication status of the navigation data used to compute the satellite's position in current navigation epoch. If the authentication fails, the navigation data will not be used so the authentication status in this message can only take two values: 0 = Unknown, 1 = Authenticated

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

fields.name: gmsLon
fields.description: Longitude of the used ground monitoring station

fields.name: gmsLat
fields.description: Latitude of the used ground monitoring station

fields.name: gmsCode
fields.description: Code of the used ground monitoring station according to the QZSS SLAS Interface Specification, available from qzss.go.jp/en/

fields.name: qzssSvId
fields.description: Satellite identifier of the QZS/GEO whose correction data is used (see Satellite Numbering)

bits.name: gmsAvailable
bits.description: 1 = Ground monitoring station available

bits.name: qzssSvAvailable
bits.description: 1 = Correction providing QZSS SV available

bits.name: testMode
bits.description: 1 = Currently used QZSS SV in test mode

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: gpsFix
fields.description: GPSfix Type, this value does not qualify a fix as valid and within the limits. See note on flag gpsFixOk below. • 0x00 = no fix • 0x01 = dead reckoning only • 0x02 = 2D-fix • 0x03 = 3D-fix • 0x04 = GPS + dead reckoning combined • 0x05 = Time only fix • 0x06..0xff = reserved

bits.name: gpsFixOk
bits.description: 1 = position and velocity valid and within DOP and ACC Masks.

bits.name: diffSoln
bits.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

bits.name: wknSet
bits.description: 1 = Week Number valid (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: towSet
bits.description: 1 = Time of Week valid (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: diffCorr
bits.description: 1 = differential corrections available

bits.name: carrSolnValid
bits.description: 1 = valid carrSoln

bits.name: mapMatching
bits.description: map matching status: • 00: none • 01: valid but not used, i.e. map matching data was received, but was too old • 10: valid and used, map matching data was applied • 11: valid and used, map matching data was applied. In case of sensor unavailability map matching data enables dead reckoning. This requires map matched latitude/longitude or heading data.

bits.name: psmState
bits.description: power save mode state (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01) • 0 = ACQUISITION (or when psm disabled) • 1 = TRACKING • 2 = POWER OPTIMIZED TRACKING • 3 = INACTIVE

bits.name: spoofDetState
bits.description: Spoofing detection state (not supported for protocol versions less than 18.00) • 0: Unknown or deactivated • 1: No spoofing indicated • 2: Spoofing indicated • 3: Multiple spoofing indications

bits.name: carrSoln
bits.description: Carrier phase range solution status: • 0 = no carrier phase range solution • 1 = carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities • 2 = carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities

fields.name: ttff
fields.description: Time to first fix (millisecond time tag)

messages.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEBDS
messages.description: BeiDou time solution - reports the precise BDS time of the most recent navigation solution including validity flags and an accuracy estimate

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: SOW
fields.description: BDS time of week (rounded to seconds)

fields.name: fSOW
fields.description: Fractional part of SOW (range: +/-500000000). The precise BDS time of week in seconds is: SOW + fSOW * 1e-9

fields.name: week
fields.description: BDS week number of the navigation epoch

bits.name: sowValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid SOW and FSOW (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: weekValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid week (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: leapSValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid leap second

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: galTow
fields.description: Galileo time of week (rounded to seconds)

fields.name: fGalTow
fields.description: Fractional part of the Galileo time of week (range: +/-500000000). The precise Galileo time of week in seconds is: galTow + fGalTow * 1e-9

bits.name: galTowValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid galTow and fGalTow (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: galWnoValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid galWno (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: leapSValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid leapS

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: TOD
fields.description: GLONASS time of day (rounded to integer seconds)

fields.name: fTOD
fields.description: Fractional part of TOD (range: +/-500000000). The precise GLONASS time of day in seconds is: TOD + fTOD * 1e-9

fields.name: Nt
fields.description: Current date (range: 1-1461), starting at 1 from the 1st Jan of the year indicated by N4 and ending at 1461 at the 31st Dec of the third year after that indicated by N4

bits.name: todValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid TOD and fTOD (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: dateValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid N4 and Nt (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: fTOW
fields.description: Fractional part of iTOW (range: +/-500000). The precise GPS time of week in seconds is: (iTOW * 1e-3) + (fTOW * 1e-9)

fields.name: week
fields.description: GPS week number of the navigation epoch

bits.name: towValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid GPS time of week (iTOW & fTOW, (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: weekValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid GPS week number (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: leapSValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid GPS leap seconds

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: srcOfCurrLs
fields.description: Information source for the current number of leap seconds.

fields.name: currLs
fields.description: Current number of leap seconds since start of GPS time (Jan 6, 1980). It reflects how much GPS time is ahead of UTC time. Galileo number of leap seconds is the same as GPS. BeiDou number of leap seconds is 14 less than GPS. GLONASS follows UTC time, so no leap seconds.

fields.name: srcOfLsChange
fields.description: Information source for the future leap second event.

fields.name: lsChange
fields.description: Future leap second change if one is scheduled. +1 = positive leap second, -1 = negative leap second, 0 = no future leap second event scheduled or no information available. If the value is 0, then the amount of leap seconds did not change and the event should be ignored.

fields.name: timeToLsEvent
fields.description: Number of seconds until the next leap second event, or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled. If > 0 event is in the future, = 0 event is now, < 0 event is in the past. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

fields.name: dateOfLsGpsWn
fields.description: GPS week number (WN) of the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

fields.name: dateOfLsGpsDn
fields.description: GPS day of week number (DN) for the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1. (GPS and Galileo DN: from 1 = Sun to 7 = Sat. BeiDou DN: from 0 = Sun to 6 = Sat.)

bits.name: validCurrLs
bits.description: 1 = Valid current number of leap seconds value.

bits.name: validTimeToLsEvent
bits.description: 1 = Valid time to next leap second event or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch.

fields.name: qzssTow
fields.description: QZSS time of week (rounded to seconds)

fields.name: fQzssTow
fields.description: Fractional part of QZSS time of week (range: +/-500000000). The precise QZSS time of week in seconds is: qzssTow + (fQzssTow * 1e-9)

fields.name: qzssWno
fields.description: QZSS week number of the navigation epoch

bits.name: qzssTowValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid QZSS time of week (qzssTow and fQzssTow)

bits.name: qzssWnoValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid QZSS week number

bits.name: leapSValid
bits.description: 1 = Valid QZSS leap seconds

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch.

bits.name: validTOW
bits.description: 1 = Valid Time of Week (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: validWKN
bits.description: 1 = Valid Week Number (see section Time validity in the integration manual for details)

bits.name: validUTC
bits.description: 1 = Valid UTC Time

bits.name: utcStandard
bits.description: UTC standard identifier. (Not supported for protocol versions less than 15.00)

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

messages.name: UBX-RXM-MEAS20
messages.description: Satellite measurements for CloudLocate location service (20 bytes message)

messages.name: UBX-RXM-MEAS50
messages.description: Satellite measurements for CloudLocate location service (50 bytes message)

messages.name: UBX-RXM-MEASC12
messages.description: Satellite measurements for CloudLocate location service (second 12 bytes message)

messages.name: UBX-RXM-MEASD12
messages.description: Satellite measurements for CloudLocate location service (first 12 bytes message)

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Number of satellites in repeated block

bits.name: towSet
bits.description: TOW set (0 = no, 1 or 2 = yes)

fields.name: mpathIndic
fields.description: multipath index (according to [1]) (0 = not measured, 1 = low, 2 = medium, 3 = high)

fields.name: wholeChips
fields.description: whole value of the code phase measurement (0..1022 for GPS)

fields.name: fracChips
fields.description: fractional value of the code phase measurement (0..1023)

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the requested task. The maximum supported value is 12 days. Set to 0 to wait for a wakeup signal on a pin

bits.name: backup
bits.description: Set to 1 to put the receiver into backup mode

bits.name: force
bits.description: Set to 1 for minimum power consumption

fields.name: wakeupSources
fields.description: Configure pins to wake up the receiver. The receiver wakes up if there is either a falling or a rising edge on one of the configured pins.

bits.name: uarttx
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the UART RX pin

bits.name: extint0
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT0 pin

bits.name: extint1
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT1 pin

bits.name: spics
bits.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the SPI CS pin

fields.name: svId
fields.description: Identifier of transmitting satellite (see Satellite Numbering)

fields.name: beacon
fields.description: Beacon identifier (60 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first. Top four bits of first byte are zero.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters (16 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first.

fields.name: svId
fields.description: Identifier of transmitting satellite (see Satellite Numbering)

fields.name: beacon
fields.description: Beacon identifier (60 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first. Top four bits of first byte are zero.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters (16 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first.

fields.name: freqId
fields.description: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

fields.name: numWords
fields.description: The number of data words contained in this message (up to 10, for currently supported signals)

fields.name: chn
fields.description: The tracking channel number the message was received on

messages.name: UBX-SEC-UNIQID
messages.description: This message is used to retrieve a unique chip identifier (48 bits, 6 bytes).

fields.name: ch
fields.description: Channel (i.e. EXTINT) upon which the pulse was measured

bits.name: mode
bits.description: 0=single, 1=running

bits.name: run
bits.description: 0=armed, 1=stopped

bits.name: newFallingEdge
bits.description: New falling edge detected

bits.name: timeBase
bits.description: 0=Time base is Receiver time, 1=Time base is GNSS time (the system according to the configuration in CFG-TP Configuration Items for tpIdx=0), 2=Time base is UTC (the variant according to the configuration in CFG-NAVSPG-* configuration items)

bits.name: utc
bits.description: 0=UTC not available, 1=UTC available

bits.name: time
bits.description: 0=Time is not valid, 1=Time is valid (Valid GNSS fix)

bits.name: newRisingEdge
bits.description: New rising edge detected

fields.name: wnR
fields.description: Week number of last rising edge

fields.name: wnF
fields.description: Week number of last falling edge

fields.name: towSubMsR
fields.description: Millisecond fraction of tow of rising edge in nanoseconds

fields.name: towSubMsF
fields.description: Millisecond fraction of tow of falling edge in nanoseconds

fields.name: towMS
fields.description: Time pulse time of week according to time base

fields.name: week
fields.description: Time pulse week number according to time base

bits.name: timeBase
bits.description: Time base is GNSS (0) or UTC (1)

bits.name: utc
bits.description: UTC not available (0) or UTC available (1)

bits.name: raim
bits.description: RAIM information: Information not available (0), Not active (1), Active (2)

bits.name: qErrInvalid
bits.description: Quantization error valid (0) or invalid (1)

bits.name: tpNotLocked
bits.description: Next TP is locked to GNSS (0) or based on local time (1)

bits.name: timeRefGnss
bits.description: GNSS reference information: GPS (0), GLONASS (1), BeiDou (2), Galileo (3), NavIC (4), Unknown (15)

bits.name: utcStandard
bits.description: UTC standard identifier: Information not available (0), CRL (1), NIST (2), USNO (3), BIPM (4), European laboratories (5), SU (6), NTSC China (7), NPLI (8), Unknown (15)

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: integer millisecond tow received by source

fields.name: deltaMs
fields.description: integer milliseconds of delta time (current time minus sourced time)

bits.name: src
bits.description: Aiding time source

messages.name: UBX-UPD-SOS
messages.description: The messages in the UBX-UPD class are used to download a firmware to the receiver and to update the firmware on the flash.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: A bit mask showing the major GNSS that can be supported by this receiver

bits.name: GPSSup
bits.description: GPS is supported

bits.name: GlonassSup
bits.description: GLONASS is supported

bits.name: BeidouSup
bits.description: BeiDou is supported

bits.name: GalileoSup
bits.description: Galileo is supported

fields.name: defaultGnss
fields.description: A bit mask showing the default major GNSS selection

bits.name: GPSDef
bits.description: GPS is default-enabled

bits.name: GlonassDef
bits.description: GLONASS is default-enabled

bits.name: BeidouDef
bits.description: BeiDou is default-enabled

bits.name: GalileoDef
bits.description: Galileo is default-enabled

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: A bit mask showing the current major GNSS selection enabled for this receiver

bits.name: GPSEna
bits.description: GPS is enabled

bits.name: GlonassEna
bits.description: GLONASS is enabled

bits.name: BeidouEna
bits.description: BeiDou is enabled

bits.name: GalileoEna
bits.description: Galileo is enabled

fields.name: simultaneous
fields.description: Maximum number of concurrent major GNSS that can be supported by this receiver
